elements.description:
An element to transform AMF LD model into a form view model.

Note, this element does not include polyfills for `Promise` and `Array.from`.

The model should be used to build a form view for request parameters
like header, query parameters, uri parameters or the body.

### Data model
- binding {String} - one of `path`, `query`, `header`
- name {String} - property (form) name
- required {Boolean} - is property required
- value {any} - Value of the property
- description {String} - The description of the property
- hasDescription {Boolean} - Flag describing if the property has a
description.
- properties {Array<Object>} - If the model is a type of object it is a list
of this model objects.
- schema {Object} - Property schma information
- schema.type {String} - Data type of the property
- schema.inputLabel {String} Label for the form control
- schema.inputType {String} - type attribute of the `input` element.
- schema.pattern {String} - Regex pattern of the property
- schema.minLength {Number} - String property minimum length
- schema.maxLength {Number} - String property maximum length
- schema.defaultValue {any} - Default value of the property
- schema.examples {Array<Object>} - List of examples for the form property.
- schema.multipleOf {Number} - For numeric values, a `step` attribute of
the `input` element.
Each object may contain `name` (may be undefined) and must contain `value`
property of the example.
- schema.minimum {Number} - For numeric values, minimum value of the property
- schema.maximum {Number} - For numeric values, maximum value of the property
- schema.isEnum {Boolean} - Flag describing enumerable value
- schema.enum {Array<any>} - Only if `schema.isEnum` is set. Values for enum
input.
- schema.isArray {Boolean} - Flag describing array value for the property
- schema.items {Object} - Lsit of items definitions
- schema.isBool {Boolean} - Flag describing boolean value for the property
- schema.isFile {Boolean} - Flag describing File value for the property
- schema.isObject {Boolean} - Flag describing Object value for the property
- schema.inputPlaceholder {?String} - A placeholder value for the input.
- schema.inputFloatLabel {Boolean} - Only if placeholder is set. Instructs
input control to float a label.
- schema.isUnion {Boolean} - Flag describing union value
- schema.anyOf {Array<Object>} - List of possible types of the union.
- schema.enabled {Boolean} - Always `true`
- schema.fileTypes {Array<String>} List of file types defined for a file
type.
## Example

```html
<api-view-model-transformer on-view-model-changed="_updateView"></api-view-model-transformer>
<script>
const amfModel = getAmfFromRamlOrOas();
const processor = document.querySelector('api-view-model-transformer');
processor.amfModel = amfModel;
processor.shape = extractHeadersForMethod(amfModel);
processor.addEventListener('view-model-changed', (e) => {
 console.log(e.detail.value);
});
< /script>
```

This example uses `getAmfFromRamlOrOas()` function where you implement
the logic of getting AMF json/ld data. It can be stored in file or parsed
using AMF parsers. The `extractHeadersForMethod()` represents a logic to
extract properties that you want to transform. It can be headers, query
parameters or body type.

## JSON ld context

JSON schema may contain `@context` property. It can be used to reduce size
of the schema by replacing namespace ids with defined in `@context` keywords.
This transformer does not consume whole AMF model, but only the portion that
should be transformed. Because of that the tranformer is missing context
for namespace resolving. Set `@context` value of the model to `amfContext`
property so it can be expanded to the canonical form.
**Tranformation won't work properly if namespace name are altered by context
and `amfContext` property is not set.**

properties.name: eventsTarget
properties.description:
Events handlers target. By default the element listens on
`window` object. If set, all events listeners will be attached to this
object instead of `window`.

properties.name: _oldEventsTarget
properties.description: An event target used to attach listeners.

properties.name: amfModel
properties.description:
Generated AMF json/ld model form the API spec.
The element assumes the object of the first array item to be a
type of `"http://raml.org/vocabularies/document#Document`
on AMF vocabulary.

It is only used to resolve references.

properties.name: shape
properties.description:
An array of propertues for which view model is to be generated.
It accepts model for headers, query parameters, uri parameters and
body.
If `manualModel` is not set, assigning a value to this property will
trigger model computation. Otherwise call `computeViewModel()`
function manually to generate the model.

properties.name: manualModel
properties.description:
If set, assigning a value to `shape` will not trigger view model
computation.

properties.name: _references
properties.description:
The declarations model computed from the AMF object. It is used when the
transformer attempt to transform link value.

If this property is not set then it dispatches `amf-resolve-link`
custom event.

methods.name: _eventsTargetChanged
methods.description:
Removes old handlers (if any) and attaches listeners on new event
event target.

params.name: eventsTarget
params.description:
Event target to set handlers on. If not set it
will set handlers on the `window` object.

methods.name: _shapeChanged
methods.description:
Called when either `shape` or `manualModel` propeties changed.
If `manualModel` is falsy then it calls `computeViewModel()` function.

Note, this function won't be called when sub property of the model
change. For peformance rerasons it won't be supported.

Note, `computeViewModel` is called asynchronusly so `amfContext`
property can be set.

methods.name: computeViewModel
methods.description:
Computes view model from AMF data model. This should not be called if
`manualModel` is not set. Use `shape` property instead.

params.name: shape
params.description:
AMF type model. If not set it uses `shape`
property of the element.

return.desc: A promise resolved to generated model.

methods.name: _computeViewModelRecursive
methods.description:
Conputes model for each item recursively. It allows browser to return
the event loop and prohibit ANR to show.

params.name: items
params.description:
List of remanding AMF model items.
This shuld be copy of the model since this function removes items from
the list.

params.name: result
params.description:
Result of model comupation. It's repoted by
the Promise.

return.desc: Promise resolved to thre view model.

methods.name: uiModelForAmfItem
methods.description: Creates a UI model item from AMF json/ld model.

methods.name: _uiModelForParameter
methods.description: Creates a UI model item from AMF json/ld model for a parameter.

methods.name: _uiModelForPropertyShape
methods.description: Creates a UI model item from AMF json/ld model for a parameter.

methods.name: modelForRawObject
methods.description:
Creates a view model for an object definition. Object definition can be
part of trait or annotation properties description.

methods.name: _uiModelForRawObject
methods.description: Creates a view model from "raw" item (model before resolving).

params.name: key
params.description: Key of the item in the model.

methods.name: _processAfterItemCreated
methods.description:
Sets up additional properties like `value` or placeholder from
values read from the AMF model.

methods.name: _completeInputLabel
methods.description: Completes computation of input label.

methods.name: _computeParameterSchema
methods.description: Computes schema property of the view model from AMF model.

params.name: opts

return.desc: Schema part of the view model

methods.name: _computeRawExamples
methods.description: Computes list of examples from the Raw data model.

methods.name: _hasType
methods.description: Checks if a model has a type.

return.desc: True if model has a type.

methods.name: _computeBinding
methods.description: Computes value of the `binding` property of the UI model.

return.desc: Binding property or undefined if not found.

methods.name: _computeFormName
methods.description: Computes fomm (parameter) name from AMF model.

return.desc: Name property or undefined if not found.

methods.name: _computeDescription
methods.description: Computes description from AMF model.

return.desc: Description property or undefined if not found.

methods.name: _computeRequired
methods.description: Computes rwquired property from AMF model.

return.desc: True if the property is required.

methods.name: _computeModelType
methods.description: Computes type of the model. It's RAML data type property.

methods.name: _computeRawModelValue
methods.description: Computes type of the raw model.

methods.name: _computeRawScalarValue
methods.description: Computes scalar value that has proper type.

params.name: item
params.description: Shape to test for a value.

methods.name: _computeInputLabel
methods.description: Computes form input label value.

params.name: required
params.description: True if the property is required

methods.name: _computeShaclProperty
methods.description:
Computes the value of a property that namespace starts with
`http://www.w3.org/ns/shacl`.

return.desc: Value of the property or undefined if not set.

methods.name: _computeVocabularyShapeProperty
methods.description:
Computes the value of a property that namespace starts with
`http://raml.org/vocabularies/shapes`.

return.desc: Value of the property or undefined if not set.

methods.name: _computePropertyValue
methods.description: Computes value of model property.

methods.name: _computeModelEnum
methods.description: Computes enum values for the view model.

methods.name: _computeEnumIterator
methods.description: Computesa value for the `enum` property in the view model.

methods.name: _getSchemaSafeValue
methods.description: Gets a value (`@value`) for a property without exceptions.

methods.name: _computeModelExamples
methods.description: Computes list of examples for the Property model.

return.desc:
List of examples or `undefined` if not
defined.

methods.name: _computeModelItems
methods.description: Computes `items` property for AMF array property

methods.name: _isLink
methods.description: Tests if current model part is actually a link to definition

methods.name: _computeReferences
methods.description: Comnputes list of references to be used to resolve links.

methods.name: _importLink
methods.description:
Attempty to resolve declaration of a link.
It tries tor use `_references` property if it's set. Otherwise
it sends `amf-resolve-link` custom event to ask hosting application
for the data.

methods.name: _searchDeclaration
methods.description: Searches `_references` property for an id.

return.desc: Model declaration or undefined if not found.

methods.name: _requestDeclaration
methods.description:
Dispatches `amf-resolve-link` custom event to ask hosting application
to resolve AMF model link.

return.desc: Model declaration or undefined if not found.

methods.name: _exampleAsValue
methods.description: Parses a string from example or enum value to be used as default value.

params.name: example
params.description: Example value to process as a value

params.name: opts
params.description:
Options:
- name {String} Processed property name
- valueDelimiter {?String} either `:` for headers or `=` for query params
- decodeValues {Boolean} True to url decode value.

methods.name: __parseArrayExample
methods.description: Parses example in an array type.

return.desc: Array of examples or string if cannot parse

methods.name: _computeModelInputType
methods.description:
Computes rendered item input field type based on RAML definition.

It will be either numeric or text. Type will be determined from
item's type or, in case of array, item's items property.

methods.name: _computeModelPattern
methods.description: Computes pattern for the input.

return.desc: Pattern or undefined if does not exists.

methods.name: _computeTypePlaceholder
methods.description: Computes a placeholder value for data and time inputs.

methods.name: _buildPropertyHandler
methods.description:
Handler for the `api-property-model-build` custom event.
Builds a property view model using event detail object as a base object.

All changes are applied to the `detail` object. Requesting element must
use the same object.

methods.name: buildProperty
methods.description: Builds empty view model without traversing AMF model.

params.name: defaults
params.description:
View model with default values. This values won't
be set.

methods.name: _computeHasExtendedDocumentation
methods.description:
Computes if model item has documentation to display.
This would be extended documentation by adding additional description
properties that helps the user to input values into the editor.

return.desc: True if documentation can be rendered.

methods.name: _computeExtendedDocumentation
methods.description: Computes documentation as a markdown to be placed in the `marked-element`

methods.name: computeDisplayJson
methods.description: Computes a JSON object to display from view model propertiers

methods.name: computeDisplayXml
methods.description: Computes an XML schema to display from view model propertiers

elements.name: ApiElements.ApiViewModelTransformer

attributes.name: events-target
attributes.description:
Events handlers target. By default the element listens on
`window` object. If set, all events listeners will be attached to this
object instead of `window`.

attributes.name: amf-model
attributes.description:
Generated AMF json/ld model form the API spec.
The element assumes the object of the first array item to be a
type of `"http://raml.org/vocabularies/document#Document`
on AMF vocabulary.

It is only used to resolve references.

attributes.name: shape
attributes.description:
An array of propertues for which view model is to be generated.
It accepts model for headers, query parameters, uri parameters and
body.
If `manualModel` is not set, assigning a value to this property will
trigger model computation. Otherwise call `computeViewModel()`
function manually to generate the model.

attributes.name: manual-model
attributes.description:
If set, assigning a value to `shape` will not trigger view model
computation.
